website_summaries.verdict: This saddle offers a nice blend of support and versatility for a decent price, earning it our top pick for value.
pros: Lightweight, contoured saddle that's suitable for riding on pavement or trails
Narrow design provides reliable control on challenging terrain and hills
Padding is supportive where you need it most
cons: Can be a bit uncomfortable on long rides
Tends to squeak, which may be annoying to some customers

customer_reviews.title: Good light MTB saddle
customer_reviews.text: I took this saddle on a 12 mile ride yesterday for the first time (450' elev climbed). My previous seat was really plush compared to this one. I wish it was just a liiiiittle more padded, but it's still a really solid saddle. My butt was slightly sore by the end of the ride, but I think I'll adjust in time. Plus, I'm sure these saddles have some sort of break-in period where they wear-in and soften eventually. All-in-all this was a great buy and a really comfortable seat. I like how much more maneuverable it is when I have to get back in a more agressive position for downhills.
customer_reviews.author: Trey L

customer_reviews.title: Comfort without the excess
customer_reviews.text: It supports the sits, it has just enough cushion where it's needed, and it isn't excessively padded all over everywhere else. Doesn't get in the way or chafe, and allows a wide range of positions, from butt all the way back relaxed to a very forward position on the nose. Easy to get out of for climbs as well, however little I might like doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing for smaller framed riders!
customer_reviews.text: It is more firm than the commuter seat that came with my Fuji Feather, but less firm than the thin Specialized seats. At 5'7 with a 30' waist, the 133 width fits my seat bones perfectly and I don't feel sore at all after a half hour on the saddle. The profile of the seat also means my weightlifter legs aren't hitting or chaffing on the edge. All in all this seat will be with me for a long time, and I'll be ordering another when it gives out.
customer_reviews.author: ExpatJohnny

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: At almost 40 I am new to riding bike so I asked a friend and he recommended this seat because my butt was hurting with the factory seat. He said less padding is actually better. I thought he was nuts but he does those 500 mile rides so he must know something. So I bought and it is great. Fixed a lot of my issues. Quality product
customer_reviews.author: Wilson S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice seat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement seat for my hardtail after the CroMo version snapped its rails. Good seat, light and well designed with just the right amount of padding in the important spots. Only issue is that the rails are a tad short so I have the seat adjusted to all the way back. Could be a lil more room for adjustments, thats it. Good seat
customer_reviews.author: apice

customer_reviews.title: Nice saddle.  Had a WTB Volt before, hated that thing.
customer_reviews.text: Nice saddle. Had a WTB Volt before, hated that thing. Both my WTB saddles creak in the rails to shell area (not the seat clamp)
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best saddle I’ve had mountain biking
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ridden maybe half a dozen saddles mountain biking, this is by far the most comfortable. I have about 100 mi on the saddle so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: it was heavier than my other saddle I had bought, and hard as a rock ! team junk is what I say !
customer_reviews.author: keith christy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful saddle
customer_reviews.text: A major upgrade from my stock saddle. It is about a half inch more narrow but it makes maneuvering around the bike way easier. I don't catch on my seat when leaning back over the rear tire anymore!
customer_reviews.author: dustin short

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very solid saddle. I got the pro and I’m very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy saddle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saddle as a replacement for my 2007 Gary Fisher Piranha. Saddle is comfortable and sturdy. I haven't had any issues. It's almost more comfortable than the saddles on my new $1,300 and $4,000 bike.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Mendez

customer_reviews.title: the right saddle i wanted
customer_reviews.text: it's the perfect saddle i wanted to look in proportion with the smaller dropper post shaft. feels perfect too during the ride, not so comfy as the WTB Pure saddle i replaced but no pain either. my next saddle buy will still be a WTB.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ramil Carillo

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresentation of colors
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but deceiving. I was shipped a RED and black saddle, not a GREY and black saddle. For those who want to coordinate colors, it's money wasted. BOLO, as you could get either color scheme!? ..for what it's worth. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: This is the only saddle I use
customer_reviews.text: My go to saddle for MTB and Gravel bikes. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: mark vojtko

customer_reviews.title: Great Seat
customer_reviews.text: Nice padding but retains low weight and size. Recommend by BKXC and I gave it a try - great.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne 1

customer_reviews.title: Not all black
customer_reviews.text: The picture is misleading as the saddle that was sent to me is not all black but has a red trim.
customer_reviews.author: Minor Assembly Required

customer_reviews.title: Great saddle. No frills
customer_reviews.text: Great saddle. No frills. It just works as it should. I put it on a Santa Cruz and it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hutson

customer_reviews.title: Better seat
customer_reviews.text: It replaced a broken seat that we had on the bike, so it looks better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, good value
customer_reviews.text: Got this seat as a replacement for my broken MTB seat. Works great, is comfortable, and was well worth the price. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable seat
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable seat! Replaced Fizik saddle that came with my bike. This one feels softer and fits me better.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I'd rather sit on a rock
customer_reviews.text: This came with my new Ibis Mojo HD4 and since it looked a lot like my go to Volt saddle I was prepared for a similar comfort level. It wasn't all that bad for the first 10 miles but then quickly turned into torture. So painful to sit on it sapped all of my energy. Time to buy another Volt.
customer_reviews.author: Camper Van Beethoven

product_meta.title: WTB Silverado Carbon 133 Black Saddle
product_meta.description: Style:Carbon| Size:133mmThe Silverado's long padded nose and gradual taper provide an excellent shelf for when the going gets steep while the broad lowere wall of the outside shell creates a great shape for leaning into corners when the trail gets twisty. A slight rise and optimized padding to weight ratio make the Silverado a hit across disciplines, including road. Ride a Silverado and you'll quickly know what everyone's raving about.
feature_bullets: Cross Country / Road / Microfiber Cover / Carbon Composite Shell / DNA Padding
The long, tapered nose and a slightly rounded profile
Optimized padding-to-weight ratio make the Silverado a hit across all disciplines, including road
